item.title: R Data Structures
item.description: Truth is ever to be found in simplicity, and not in the multiplicity and confusion of things. - Isaac Newton When I first encountered R, I approached it the same way I would start to learn any language. I jumped into for-loops, conditional statements, user-defined functions, classes, and so on. I didn’t pay much attention to data types at first - assuming they’re not much different than what I’ve seen already.
